message.content:
cs.CC, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.DM. 

The paper deals with the problem of polynomial identity testing (PIT) and hitting-set generators (HSG), which are central topics in computational complexity theory. The paper also mentions the use of algebraic hardness assumptions, which is a common theme in complexity theory. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CC (Computational Complexity). The paper also involves some information theory (cs.IT) and combinatorics (cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.DM) in the construction of HSGs, which makes these sub-categories likely as well.
